equipmentList.name: 4Qt Mixing Bowl
equipmentList.imageAlt: A pyrex 4 quart glass mixing bowl.
equipmentList.why: I prefer glass bowls for rising dough. They are easy to clean, do not retain odors, and allow me to see the dough rise.

equipmentList.name: 8Qt Storage Container
equipmentList.imageAlt: Clear 8 quart storage container with a lid.
equipmentList.why: I am familiar with Cambro containers from my time working at a bakery.They are durable, stackable, and easy to clean. The eight quart size holds a 10 pound bag of flour perfectly.

equipmentList.name: Blender Spatula
equipmentList.imageAlt: A blue, long, straight spatula perfect for scraping the sides of a blender.
equipmentList.why: I love how will this spatula scrapes the sides and lip of my sourdough jars. I used one at my mother-in-law's house and had to get one for myself. Now I have two.

equipmentList.name: Bread Lame
equipmentList.imageAlt: A bread lame with a wooden handle and a replaceable blade.
equipmentList.why: I love the way the lame (pronounced 'lahm') cuts the dough. It is sharp and precise, and I love the way it slices the dough.

equipmentList.name: Cloth Jar Cover
equipmentList.imageAlt: Canvas jar covers with elastic edges, includes 4 covers and one shown on a jar.
equipmentList.why: I love how easy these are to use. They fit over the top of my jars and allow the starter to breathe while keeping dust and bugs out. I used to use cheesecloth, but these are so much easier to use and clean. I can just throw them in the washing machine with my towels and they come out clean and ready to use again.

equipmentList.name: Danish Dough Whisk
equipmentList.imageAlt: A Dainish dough whisk with a stainless steel handle.
equipmentList.why: I love the way dough comes together with this whisk. It is easy to use and clean. I prefer this to a wooden spoon. I had a similar one with a wood handle, but it broke after a few months of use. This one is stainless steel and is far more durable.

equipmentList.name: Digital Candy Thermometer
equipmentList.imageAlt: A digital candy thermomether with a stainless steel probe and a digital display.
equipmentList.why: I love that I can set my target temperature and it will beep when it gets within three degrees of the target.

equipmentList.name: Electric Bread Knife
equipmentList.imageAlt: An electric knife on a wooden stand with a carving blade and bread blade.
equipmentList.why: I love how perfect the bread slices are with this knife. I also love the wood stand that it comes with. It is easy to store and looks great on my counter.

equipmentList.name: Enameled Cast Iron Loaf Pan with Lid
equipmentList.imageAlt: Red enameld cast iron loaf pan with a lid. Pictured with a loaf inside and accessories.
equipmentList.why: I love how evenly this pan heats. It is perfect for baking sourdough bread. I love the lid that comes with it, it helps to create a perfect crust. This is a new item in my kitchen, the recipe pictures show my previous favorite bread pan. I am planning on slowly replacing my old pans with this one as I can afford it.

equipmentList.name: Kitchen Scale
equipmentList.imageAlt: A black kitchen scale with a glass top, made by Taylor.
equipmentList.why: I love being precise with my measurements. This scale is easy to use and has a tare function that allows me to zero out the weight of my bowl or container. I love that it has a glass top that is easy to clean. My scale is an older model, but this is the one I will replace it with when it breaks.

equipmentList.name: Label Maker
equipmentList.imageAlt: A black label maker with digital display and three rolls of tape.
equipmentList.why: I love having my pantry look uniform. I got this as a Mother's Day gift a few years ago and I use it to label just about everything.

equipmentList.name: Measuring Spoon
equipmentList.imageAlt: Adjustable measuring spoon with a zinc alloy handle and a plastic slider.
equipmentList.why: I love how easy this is to use. I have tablespoon and teaspoon versions. It has a sturdy construction and is easy to clean.

equipmentList.name: Plastic Bowl Covers
equipmentList.imageAlt: A bag of 100 reusable plastic bowl covers.
equipmentList.why: I love how well these retain moisture and how I can see the dough rise.I used to use damp towels, but these have a much better seal.

equipmentList.name: Silicone Bread Pan Liner
equipmentList.imageAlt: Two silicone bread pan liners, with handles. Shown flat and in a bread pan.
equipmentList.why: I love how this is reusable. I used to use parchment paper, but this is so much easier to use and clean and does not create waste.

equipmentList.name: Slicing Guide
equipmentList.imageAlt: A white bread slicing guide. Shown with a sliced loaf of bread.
equipmentList.why: I love have consistent slices of bread. This guide is easy to use and clean. I love that it is collapsible and easy to store.

equipmentList.name: Storage Containers
equipmentList.imageAlt: Clear storage containers with black airtight lids. Shown stacked.
equipmentList.why: I love how these are airtight and stackable. My entire pantry is organized with these containers. I love that they are clear so I can see what is inside without opening them. My food stays safe and my spices stay fresh.

equipmentList.name: Wide Mouth Mason Jar, 64 oz
equipmentList.imageAlt: 2 Ball wide mouth mason jars, 64 oz, with lids
equipmentList.why: I love how much I can fit in these jars. I usually cook more than one loaf of bread at a time and these jars can hold a lot of starter. I have a few and change them out as I need to.
